text:
A Playful Idea

A dimly lit room, tension thickens.  
Raskolnikov frowns at Razumihin.  
Razumihin: “Could you ever rob or murder?”  

---

Same room, Razumihin winks playfully.  
Raskolnikov: “I wouldn’t tell you if I did!”  
Razumihin: “Just curious about your article!”  

---

Raskolnikov glares, disgusted.  
Raskolnikov: “I’m no Napoleon or Mahomet!”  
Porfiry: “Don’t we all think we are?”  

---

Zametov interrupts, eyes wide.  
Zametov: “Was it one of these Napoleons?”  
Raskolnikov: *silent, contemplating the weight of words.*

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov grapples with the idea of whether extraordinary individuals can justify committing crimes for a greater purpose.
